channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes on much of Beckenham Grove, 6th February
item.description:
Potholes on much of the road have been there for weeks. Please check the whole road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Grove, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole outside Police station, 6th February
item.description:
Pothole a few inches deep and 12 inches long on Northbound carriageway outside Police station
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole missed per FixMyStreet ref: 8828586, 6th February
item.description:
Hi, can see per another resident post FixMyStreet ref: 8828586 that 5 potholes fixed but there is an equally large one further down the street here. Due to parking on both sides it is hard to avoid without almost colliding with parked cars, so needs to be filled. The road surface at the top of Highview road continues to break up several times a year during bad weather and would be more economical to resurface given the age and poor condition of this surface. Potholes that are filled typically reopen in just a few months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2b, Highview Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 117 -119 Ferney Road, 6th February
item.description:
This has been reported before it is a tripping hazard I really expect something to be done to make it safe Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Uplands Road, Brunswick Park, Greater London

item.title: Huge puddle on pavement, 6th February
item.description:
Huge puddle still blocking walkway. Needs drainage sorted. Outside the school and is becoming a nuisance when dropping/picking kids up from school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrotham Road, East Wickham, Greater London

item.title: Huge pool of water next to school playgrouns, 6th February
item.description:
Whenever it rains heavily the footpath becomes completely flooded and not passable for pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Southbury, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Bike 2 years +, 6th February
item.description:
This bike has been abandoned here for over 2 years. I have reported it several times. Once a council operative came and said that they "couldn't find it". I don't think it could be any clearer. It is an eyesore and takes up bike parking spaces. Remove asap

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old village lampost has top missing, 6th February
item.description:
This old lampost numbered 31h38 near viaduct and new build houses has the top part missing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 6th February
item.description:
Vehicle left in our Close last weekend. Driver seemed to run away. Flat tyre. The car does not have any connection to anyone living in the Close. Police advise not reported stolen at that time. MoT/tax expires March.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckingham Close, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
The path is constantly covered in mud from a vehicle that is driving through the park

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent Road, Poverest, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Water pooling, 6th February
item.description:
Rain water is pooling creating a massive puddle. The paving here was only recently laid . Is there anything that can be done?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greens End, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Courrier Vans driving onto the Grass verge, 6th February
item.description:
The grass verge at the beginning of Maple Crescent j/w Wellington Avenue down towards number 1 Maple is being driven on causing deep tyre tracks and ruts especially with the persistent rainfall. Please can we have some bollards installed to stop this from happening. This grass verge is very long and at present has no protection.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possibly loose manhole cover in road, 6th February
item.description:
Potentially a loose manhole cover in the middle of road at the junction of Barnes Cray Rd & Maiden Lane. It makes a terrible noise every time a car passes over it so assuming loose or not seated properly. The cover looks lower than the road surface so could potentially be a hazard to cars or even pedestrians crossing the road. Apologies with cars passing up & down I can't take any photos, many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Majore pothole on road in front of Heal's, 6th February
item.description:
There is a deep pothole at Tottenham Court Road, near Goodge Street station (in fron of the Heal's shop). It could be very hazardous for cyclists or motor/scooter drivers, who risk serious injury if they ride over it. The depth and low visibility of the pothole increases the danger, especially under busy traffic conditions or poor lighting. Urgent action is required

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 199, Tottenham Court Road, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71-79, Welling High Street, Welling, Greater London

item.title: Spray paint parking sign, 6th February
item.description:
Someone has spray painted a lot of the permit only parking signs in this area, this report relates to the one outside 45 langton road. I think the council should coordinate with the police about this issue which is happening a lot locally.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Langton Road, Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
